title: Isaac Vock
text: I am a PhD student at Yale University in the lab of Matthew Simon. I have developed a number of bioinformatic tools for processing and analyzing nucleotide recoding RNA-seq (NR-seq) experiments. NR-seq is a class of methods for probing the dynamics of RNA synthesis and degradation.

title: Isaac Vock
text:
Education
Yale University | New Haven, CT | August 2019 - May 2025

B.S. in Physics, Minor in Math

title: About
text:
The EZbakR-suite

Summary



Introduced Snakemake pipeline (fastq2EZbakR) and R package (EZbakR)
Generalized feature assignment: the set of annotated genomic features that you can perform analyses on
Generalized mixture modeling: how the fraction of reads from labeled RNA are estimated.
Generalized dynamical systems modeling: how kinetic parameters are estimated from NR-seq data
Generalized comparative analyses: how kinetic parameters are compared across biological conditions


Citation

title: About
text:
bakR

Summary



Introduced an R package (bakR) designed to compare RNA synthesis and degradation rate constants across biological conditions.
Also introduced a hierarchical modeling strategy to increase statistical power of these comparisons.


Citation
